author: wsjcom
title: Blue Eyes vs. Brown: Triumph or Child Abuse?
text: What an inspiring story Michael Judge tells (“My Grandfather and the ‘Blue Eyes-Brown Eyes’ Lesson,” op-ed, April 7) about a courageous teacher and an equally courageous principal who backed him when he came under attack in 1968 for teaching his young students about racial tolerance. I couldn’t help contrasting this with accounts of recent attacks on Prof. Amy Wax of the University of Pennsylvania Law School who was persecuted for suggesting, among other things, that fathers should take responsibility for the children they sire and that affirmative-action policies may harm the people they are supposed to be helping.
